page.title: 02Village Services
page.content: Though the village has only one shop, the small Post Office/General Stores, many of the villagers buy vegetables from a local smallholding. Various tradesmen visit regularly; Michael the Barber brings his van once a month, the Butcher comes twice a week, the baker/grocer who lives in the village and calls three times a week. A Fish and Chip van, and a wet fish van both visit once a week. Papers are delivered daily from the camp Post Office, and milk, from Seaman's dairies is delivered 6 days (not Sunday). The post is delivered twice a day, though only the older houses receive the second delivery. The Mobile Library visits fortnightly, and the coalman weekly. In the summer Decima visits local houses with salad ingredients. Until recently two tea rooms existed.
